title._content: [Portrait of Joe Mooney, Milt Gabler, and Morty Palitz, Decca studio, New York, N.Y., ca. Dec. 1946] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Joe Mooney, Milt Gabler, and Morty Palitz, Decca studio, New York, N.Y., ca. Dec. 1946] 1 negative : b&w ; 3 1/4 x 4 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: At his first recording session at Decca, Joe Mooney listens to a playback with Milt Gabler (center) and Morty Palitz (right). Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 235 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "Listening to the playback," Down Beat, v. 15, no. 26 (Dec. 16, 1946), p. 20. Subjects: Mooney, Joe, 1911-1975 Gabler, Milt Palitz, Morty Joe Mooney Quartet Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Accordionists--1940-1950. Decca studio Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.06361 Call Number: LC-GLB13- 0636
